Method Detail

startAuthentication

public StartAuthenticationResponse startAuthentication(java.lang.String clientId,
                                                       java.net.URI authorizeUrl,
                                                       java.net.URI redirectUrl,
                                                       java.lang.String state,
                                                       java.lang.String nonce,
                                                       java.lang.String encryptedMSISDN,
                                                       SupportedVersions versions,
                                                       AuthenticationOptions options)
Description copied from interface: IAuthenticationService
Generates an authorisation url based on the supplied options and previous discovery response.

Specified by:
startAuthentication in interface IAuthenticationService
Parameters:
clientId - The registered application ClientId (Required)
authorizeUrl - The authorization url returned by the discovery process (Required)
redirectUrl - On completion or error where the result information is sent using a HTTP 302 redirect (Required)
state - Application specified unique scope value
nonce - Application specified nonce value. (Required)
encryptedMSISDN - Encrypted MSISDN for user if returned from discovery service
versions - SupportedVersions from if null default supported versions will be used to generate the auth url
options - Optional parameters

requestToken

public RequestTokenResponse requestToken(java.lang.String clientId,
                                         java.lang.String clientSecret,
                                         java.net.URI requestTokenUrl,
                                         java.net.URI redirectUrl,
                                         java.lang.String code)
                                  throws RequestFailedException,
                                         InvalidResponseException
Description copied from interface: IAuthenticationService
Synchronous wrapper for IAuthenticationService.requestTokenAsync(String, String, URI, URI, String)

Specified by:
requestToken in interface IAuthenticationService
Parameters:
clientId - The registered application ClientId (Required)
clientSecret - The registered application ClientSecret (Required)
requestTokenUrl - The url for token requests recieved from the discovery process (Required)
redirectUrl - Confirms the redirectURI that the application used when the authorization request (Required)
code - The authorization code provided to the application via the call to the authentication/authorization API (Required)
Throws:
RequestFailedException - on failure to access endpoint.
InvalidResponseException - on failure to process response from endpoint.

requestTokenAsync

public java.util.concurrent.Future<RequestTokenResponse> requestTokenAsync(java.lang.String clientId,
                                                                           java.lang.String clientSecret,
                                                                           java.net.URI requestTokenUrl,
                                                                           java.net.URI redirectUrl,
                                                                           java.lang.String code)
Description copied from interface: IAuthenticationService
Allows an application to use the authorization code obtained from authentication/authorization to obtain an access token and related information from the authorization server.

This function requires a valid token url from the discovery process and a valid code from the initial authorization call

Specified by:
requestTokenAsync in interface IAuthenticationService
Parameters:
clientId - The registered application ClientId (Required)
clientSecret - The registered application ClientSecret (Required)
requestTokenUrl - The url for token requests recieved from the discovery process (Required)
redirectUrl - Confirms the redirectURI that the application used when the authorization request (Required)
code - The authorization code provided to the application via the call to the authentication/authorization API (Required)
